member.name: INewWindowManager.EvaluateNewWindow
member.summary: Accepts data about a new window that is attempting to display and determines whether that window should be allowed to open based on the user's preferences.
member.param: A pointer to a buffer that contains the URL of the content that will be displayed in the new window.
A pointer to a buffer that contains the name of the new window. This parameter can be NULL.
A pointer to a buffer that contains the URL that has issued the command to open the new window.
A pointer to a buffer that contains the feature string for the new window. This value can be NULL.

A boolean value used when the new content specified in pszUrl is loaded into the existing window instead of creating a new one. TRUE if the new document should replace the current document in the history list; FALSE if the new document should be given a new entry.
A flag or flags from the enumeration that provide situational information about the call to open the new window. This value can be 0 if no flags are needed.
The tick count when the last user action occurred. To find out how long ago the action occurred, call and compare the result with the value in this parameter.

returns.para: Returns standard error codes, including the following:

listheader.description: When you implement for a hosted WebBrowser control, this value instructs the WebBrowser control to use the default implementation.

member.name: INewWindowManager
member.summary: Exposes a method that determines whether a window that is launched by another window should be displayed or blocked, allowing control of pop-up windows.
